Linear Class Reference
Species

Detailed Description

A Species of linear polymers (abstract).

A linear molecule is a chain of nAtom atoms with consecutive atom indices, with nAtom - 1 bonds between neighboring atoms.

A Linear molecule may be chemically heterogeneous - different atoms and bonds in a chain may be of different types. The chemical structure of a subclass of Linear must be specified by implementing the pure virtual functions atomTypeId() and bondTypeId().

virtual int calculateAtomTypeId ( int  index) const [protected, pure virtual]

Return the atom type id for a specific atom.

Implementations of this function should return a type Id for a specified atom that this is calculated from the information read by readParam(). It is used in Linear::buildLinear() to build a chain.

Parameters:
indexlocal atom index, in the range 0, ... , nAtom_-1
Returns:
type of the specified bond

Implemented in Diblock, Homopolymer, and HomopolymerSG.

Referenced by Linear::buildLinear().

virtual int calculateBondTypeId ( int  index) const [protected, pure virtual]

Return the bond type id for a specific bond.

Bond i of a linear molecule connects atom i and atom i + 1.

Parameters:
indexlocal bond index, in the range 0, ... , nBond_ - 1
Returns:
type of the specified bond

Implemented in Diblock, Homopolymer, and HomopolymerSG.

Referenced by Linear::buildLinear().

void buildLinear ( ) [protected]

Build the chemical structure for a linear molecule.

This method must be called by readSpeciesParam() after values are set for nAtom and nBond. It allocates memory, assigns atom types to all the atoms in a generic molecule, and creates SpeciesGroup<2> objects for all of the bonds.
